title: Daytona Beach Police Rescue Kittens During Hurricane Dorian
text:
With the help of a local woman, police in Daytona Beach rescued two kittens that were stuck between two fences as Hurricane Dorian skirted Florida on Wednesday, September 4.

According to WFTV, a local resident called police when she saw the drenched kittens trapped between a wooden fence and a chain-link fence on Butler Boulevard.

Footage shared by the Daytona Beach Police Department shows officers pulling out the kittens.

“Hurricane Dorian wasn’t the most pleasant experience for these two little furballs … until our officers came to the rescue,” police wrote on Facebook. Credit: Daytona Beach Police Department via Storyful
